children.name: Yosef Granat
children.description: The early ancestor from the Bieżuń/Mazovian region.

children.name: Hirsch Granat
children.description: Ancestor and namesake for the Granat/Rimon branch.

partner.name: Hana Haya Gerlitz
partner.description: Daughter of Wolf Eliasz Gerlitz (b. 1782) and Sara Rayzel (b. 1792, d. 1857). Born and lived in Biezun, Poland. (See Gerlitz Family)

partner.name: Esther Hava Rimon (Elstein)
partner.description: Daughter of Yechiel Bunim Elstein and Gitel Rivka Granat. Died in Zichron Yaakov.

children.name: Yosef Zvi Rimon
children.description: Renowned Hebrew poet known as 'י"צ', born in Biezun, Poland. Close to Rav Kook and advisor to Shai Agnon. Buried at the Old Trumpeldor Cemetery in Tel Aviv.

partner.name: Esther Ester Rimon (Schachtin)
partner.description: Born in Vilna (Lithuania). Daughter of Zvi David Schachtin and Tova Rivka. Married poet Yosef Zvi Rimon.

children.name: Rivka Rimon
children.description: Born in Tel Aviv. Daughter of poet Yosef Zvi Rimon. Worked as an art teacher in Tel Aviv.

children.name: David Rimon
children.description: Haganah activist, Military Police founder, and Israeli author. Yakir Tel Aviv (1998). Manager of the 'Rimon School' (Typing School). Developed a unique heart attack recovery method documented in his later years. Buried in Holon.

partner.name: Rita (Sara Rivka) Rimon (Domb)
partner.description: Born in England, survived the Blitz, and met David in Safed. Partner in his typing schools and editor of his English typing books.

children.name: Rabbi Yosef Zvi Rimon
children.description: Distinguished rabbi and halachic authority. Chief Rabbi of Gush Etzion, Nasi of World Mizrachi, Rosh Yeshiva of Lev Academic Center (JCT). Great-grandson of Ephraim Eliezer Granat Rimon and grandson of poet Yosef Zvi Rimon.

partner.name: Rabbanit Sharon Rimon (Blumenzweig)
partner.description: Daughter of Rabbi Eliyahu Blumenzweig (founder of Yeshivat Hesder Yerucham). Content editor for HaTanakh website, teacher in women's midrashot, author of 'Prisms: Perspectives on the Parasha'.

children.name: Unknown Rimon
children.description: Son of David Rimon and brother of Rabbi Yosef Zvi Rimon. Worked as a doctor; spent time in jail.

children.name: Ruth Rimon
children.description: Daughter of David Rimon. Edited and adapted her father's book on heart attack recovery.

children.name: Unknown Rimon
children.description: Child of David Rimon.

children.name: Hana Haya Kaczor
children.description: Daughter of Efraim Eliezer Rimon (Granat) and Esther Hava Elstein.

children.name: Yechiel Bunim Rimon (Granat)
children.description: Son of Efraim Eliezer Rimon (Granat) and Esther Hava Elstein. Named after his maternal grandfather.

children.name: Yaakov Haim (Zvi) Rimon (Granat)
children.description: Born January 2, 1903 in Biezun, Poland. Renowned Hebrew poet and author of the religious-Zionist movement. Immigrated to Jaffa in 1909.

partner.name: Bracha Rimon (Laznowsky)
partner.description: Sister of Mordehay Laznowsky and another brother. (See Laznowsky branch for her siblings). Married Yaakov Haim Rimon.

children.name: Prof. David Gliksberg
children.description: Full Professor at the Hebrew University of Jerusalem, holding the Satinover Chair of Tax Law and Property Law. Director of the Sacher Institute of Legislative Research. Former Editor-in-Chief of Mishpatim (Law Review).

children.name: Alex Gliksberg
children.description: Sibling of David Gliksberg. Involved in literacy and archival work.

children.name: Ephraim Rimon
children.locationName: Ha-Rav Herzog St 17, Tel Aviv-Jaffa, Israel

partner.name: Talma Rimon
partner.locationName: Ha-Rav Herzog St 17, Tel Aviv-Jaffa, Israel
partner.description: Daughter of Shalom Weissbarst and Tova (Gita) Wallach. (See Weissbarst Family)

children.name: Gil Rimon
children.description: Born in Beersheba, Israel. Entrepreneur, Branding expert, and Writer.

children.name: Omer Shalom Rimon
children.description: Named after Shalom Weissbarst, his great-grandfather. Nickname: OSRG (Omer Shalom Rimon Givon).

children.name: Gitel Rivka Granat
children.description: Daughter of Josek Hersz Granat. Married Yechiel Bunim Elstein. (Found in Granat.ged)

partner.name: Yechiel Bunim Elstein
partner.description: Son of Levin and Hava Elstein. (See Elstein branch for his ancestry)

children.name: Shalom Weissbarst
children.description: Worked as an architect. Immigrated to Israel in 1921. (Deceased)

partner.name: Tova (Gita) Wallach
partner.description: Born in Ukraine. Immigrated to Israel 1921. Daughter of Shmuel Eliezer Wallach & Tsipora Kaminetsky. (See Wallach Family)

children.name: Talma Rimon (Weissburst)
children.description: Married to Ephraim Rimon.

children.name: Hana Haya Gerlitz
children.description: Wife of Josek Hersz Granat.

children.name: Tova (Gita) Wallach
children.description: Wife of Shalom Weissbarst.

children.name: Baruch Zvi Hirsh Cohen
children.description: Pioneering Chief Rabbi known as the 'Maggid of Montreal'.

children.name: Rabbi Mosheh David Rozental Hacohen
children.description: Settled in Haifa in 1922; customs official and Lehi intelligence officer.

children.name: Laznowsky Parents
children.description: Parents of Bracha Rimon (who married Yaakov Haim Rimon), Mordehay, and another brother.

children.name: Levin Elstein
children.description: Ancestor of the Elstein family. Husband of Hava Elstein. (Found in Granat.ged)

partner.name: Hava Elstein
partner.description: Wife of Levin Elstein. Nickname 'Berkov'.

children.name: Yechiel Bunim Elstein
children.description: Son of Levin and Hava Elstein. Husband of Gitel Rivka Granat. (See Granat Branch for wife and children)

children.name: Aharon Selig Schachtin
children.description: Ancestor of the Schachtin family from Vilna.

children.name: Zvi David Schachtin
children.description: Son of Aharon Selig Schachtin. From Vilna. Immigrated to Jerusalem and died in 1914. Buried at the Mount of Olives (Har HaZeitim).

partner.name: Tova Rivka Schachtin
partner.description: Mother of Esther Rimon.

children.name: Esther Ester Rimon (Schachtin)
children.description: Daughter of Zvi David and Tova Rivka Schachtin. Married poet Yosef Zvi Rimon.

children.name: Yosef Schachtin
children.description: Born in Vilna (circa 1876). Perished in the Holocaust (1941). Son of Zvi David and Tova Rivka Schachtin. Brother of Esther Rimon.

partner.name: Chaya Golda Schachtin
partner.description: Born circa 1876. Perished in the Holocaust (1941). Wife of Yosef Schachtin.

children.name: Victoria Zoref
children.description: Mother of Moshe Givon. Sister of Valentina Zoref. Known to have had a very poor sense of smell.

partner.name: Zvi Givon (Gelbman)
partner.description: Brother of Sarah Gelbman, Edit Gelbman, and an unnamed brother. The family surname was later changed from Gelbman to Givon.

children.name: Moshe Givon (Gelbman)
children.description: Married Deborah Diamentstein. Daughter of Leah Diamentstein and Ze'ev Gurfinkel.

children.name: Amir Heller
children.description: Professional surfer.

children.name: Yael Givon Rimon
children.role: G4: Artist & Co-Founder of Baixo Art Space
children.description: Creative Director and artist. Formerly active in the Hamburg art scene (colleague of Nir Alon), she now focuses on local curation in Portugal. Co-founded 'Baixo Art Space' (Rua da Serra, Aljezur) with Hadas Jackont, creating a vibrant cultural hub for exhibitions and the local artistic community. @baixoartaljezur

children.name: Omer Shalom Rimon
children.description: Named after Shalom Weissbarst, his great-grandfather. Nickname: OSRG (Omer Shalom Rimon Givon). Contributed 'Sea' and 'Land' voice recordings for Yoav Perry's 2025 Hamburg sound installation.

children.name: Nomi Rimon
children.description: Daughter of Gil and Yael. Contributed 'Sea' and 'Land' voice recordings for Yoav Perry's 2025 Hamburg sound installation.

children.name: Thomas (Tsvi) Givon
children.description: Brother of Moshe Givon. Known by the nickname 'Talmy', he is a world-renowned linguist and Distinguished Professor Emeritus at the University of Oregon.

children.name: Iris Leal
children.description: Born Iris Frumerman. Daughter of Moshe Ran. First married to Leal, then to Tamir Sher.

partner.name: Pavlina Zoref
partner.description: Family name unknown.

children.name: Valentina Zoref
children.description: Sister of Victoria Zoref. Stayed single. Was blind from around age 40.

partner.name: Lily Zoref
partner.description: Family name unknown.

children.name: Deborah Miriam Givon (Gurfinkel)
children.description: Married to Moshe Givon.

children.name: Leah Diamentstein
children.description: Sister of Rachel Diamentstein. Ancestral root in Hungary.

children.name: Rachel Diamentstein
children.description: Sister of Leah Diamentstein.

children.name: DUNICA
children.description: Biotech company founded by Daniella Givon (2018) to treat Type 1 Diabetes. Developed 'DUN T1' therapy with support from Merck.

children.name: Gelbman Patriarch
children.description: Father of the Gelbman siblings: Zvi, Sarah, Edit, and an unnamed son.

partner.name: Gelbman Matriarch
partner.description: Mother of the Gelbman siblings.

children.name: Zvi Givon (Gelbman)
children.description: Brother of Sarah Gelbman, Edit Gelbman, and an unnamed brother. Married Victoria Zoref. The family surname was later changed from Gelbman to Givon. See Givon branch for descendants.

children.name: Sarah Gelbman
children.description: Sister of Zvi Givon (Gelbman), Edit Gelbman, and an unnamed brother. Married Ármin Polgár. Grandmother of the famous Polgár chess sisters. See Polgár branch for descendants.

children.name: Edit Gelbman
children.description: Sister of Zvi Givon (Gelbman) and Sarah Gelbman. Great-aunt of Susan, Sofia, and Judit Polgár.

children.name: Gelbman Brother (Unnamed)
children.description: Brother of Zvi Givon (Gelbman), Sarah Gelbman, and Edit Gelbman. Great-uncle of the Polgár chess sisters.

children.name: Sándor Proszwimmer
children.description: Ancestral patriarch of the Proszwimmer family in Hungary.

children.name: Ármin Polgár (Proszwimmer)
children.description: Holocaust survivor who survived forced labor during World War II. After the war, he and his family changed their surname from Proszwimmer to Polgár (meaning 'citizen'). Married Sarah Gelbman.

partner.name: Sarah Gelbman
partner.description: Sister of Zvi Givon (Gelbman), Edit Gelbman, and an unnamed brother. Grandmother of the Polgár chess champions; her sibling group links the Gelbman/Givon family to the Hungarian chess prodigies.

children.name: László Polgár
children.description: Educational psychologist and chess teacher born in Gyöngyös, Hungary. Famous for his theory that 'geniuses are made, not born'. Author of 'Chess: 5334 Problems, Combinations and Games'. Raised his daughters in a specialized environment to prove this theory.

partner.name: Klára Polgár (Altberger)
partner.description: Wife of László and mother of the chess champions.

children.name: Susan Polgár (Zsuzsa)
children.description: Hungarian-American chess grandmaster. Women's World Chess Champion from 1996 to 1999. Born in Budapest, Hungary. Achieved Grandmaster title in 1991. Became top-ranked female chess player in the world at age 15 (July 1984). Married to Paul Truong (2006-present); previously married to Jacob Shutzman (1994-2006).

partner.name: Paul Truong
partner.description: American and Cambodian chess player, trainer, and organizer. Born Trương Hoài Nhân on June 2, 1965 in Saigon (Ho Chi Minh City), Vietnam. Holds USCF National Master and FIDE Master titles. Peak rating: 2395 (July 1986). Author of 'Breaking Through: How the Polgar Sisters Changed the Game of Chess'. Married Susan Polgár in 2006.

children.name: Tom Shutzman
children.description: Son of Susan Polgár.

children.name: Leeam Shutzman
children.description: Son of Susan Polgár.

children.name: Sofia Polgár (Zsófia)
children.description: Hungarian and Israeli chess player, teacher, and artist. Holds FIDE titles of International Master and Woman Grandmaster. Author of 'Polgar Tactics: 77 Chess Combinations'. Born in Budapest, Hungary. Married to Yona Kosashvili.

partner.name: Yona Kosashvili
partner.description: Israeli chess Grandmaster and surgeon. Born July 3, 1970 in Tbilisi, Georgia. Married Sofia Polgar in 1999.

children.name: Yoav Kosashvili
children.description: Son of Sofia Polgár.

children.name: Alon Kosashvili
children.description: Son of Sofia Polgár.

children.name: Judit Polgár
children.description: Hungarian chess grandmaster, widely regarded as the strongest female chess player of all time. Born in Budapest, Hungary. Only woman ranked in world top 10, only woman to achieve 2700+ rating, and only woman to compete in World Championship final stage. Married to Gusztáv Font.

partner.name: Gusztáv Font
partner.description: Husband of Judit Polgár. Married in 2000.

children.name: Hanna Font
children.description: Daughter of Judit Polgár.

children.name: Oliver Font
children.description: Son of Judit Polgár.

children.name: Liora Jackont
children.description: Mother of Gilan Jackont. Very good friend of Deborah Givon (Gurfinkel). Passed away.

children.name: Gilan Jackont
children.description: Son of Liora Jackont.

partner.name: Hadas Jackont
partner.description: Co-founder of 'Baixo Art Space' along with Yael Givon Rimon. Key figure in the Aljezur artistic community.

children.name: Avner Jackont
children.description: Older son of Hadas and Gilan. Loves soccer a lot.

children.name: Yoel Jackont
children.description: Middle son of Hadas and Gilan. Nicknamed 'yoyo'.

children.name: Millie Jackont
children.description: Smallest daughter of Hadas and Gilan. Nicknamed 'Mizy'.

children.name: Baixo Art Space
children.description: Co-founded by Hadas Jackont and Yael Givon Rimon. A center for arts and culture in Aljezur, promoting exhibitions and events as a meeting point for the artistic community. @baixoartaljezur

children.name: Leib Naor
children.description: Grandfather of Abba Naor. Perished at Fort IX during the 'Great Action'.

children.name: Abba Naor's Father
children.description: His life was saved during a selection on October 28, 1941, by a friend in the Jewish police who pulled him to the 'good' side.

partner.name: Abba Naor's Mother
partner.description: Sent to Auschwitz/Stutthof with her youngest son, Berale, where they perished.

children.name: Chaim Naor
children.description: Shot at Fort IX while searching for food.

children.name: Abba Naor
children.description: Born in Kovno, Lithuania. Survived the Kovno Ghetto, Stutthof concentration camp, and Dachau sub-camps. Served in the Shin Bet and the Mossad; key operative in Operation Moses (Sudan rescue). Refers to his large family as his 'victory'. Now splits his time between Tel Aviv and Munich, continuing to share his testimony as a witness for future generations.

children.name: Sarah Naor Harz
children.description: Runs 'Amaria', a luxury boutique hotel and retreat located in the Costa Vicentina Natural Park (Aljezur/Odeceixe), Portugal, together with David Harz.

partner.name: David Harz
partner.description: German. Formerly known as Oliver before converting from Christianity to Judaism. Runs 'Amaria', a luxury boutique hotel and retreat located in the Costa Vicentina Natural Park (Aljezur/Odeceixe), Portugal, together with Sarah Naor Harz.

children.name: Elisheva
children.description: Grandchild of Abba and half-sister to Yaakov and Miryam.

children.name: Sarah's Sister
children.description: Daughter of Abba Naor and sister to Sarah.

children.name: Berale Naor
children.description: Sent to Auschwitz/Stutthof with his mother and perished.

children.name: Moshe
children.description: Uncle of Abba Naor. Victim of the 'Great Action' at Fort IX.

partner.name: Aharon's Wife & Baby
partner.description: Victims of the Holocaust.

children.name: Sara
children.description: Aunt of Abba Naor. Victim of the 'Great Action' at Fort IX.

children.name: Zelda
children.description: Daughter of Sara, victim of the Holocaust.
